title: UK Stoplight Demo
description: A simple stoplight survey example with default values for UK.

title.es: Please enter your selected personal reference

enumNames: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Virgin Islands of the United States of America
Another gender identity or Prefer not to disclose

title.es: Please enter the currency in which you earn your main income
What is your highest educational level?
What is your highest educational level in your household
What is your primary economic activity?
Please select the geographic location of your household
Please estimate your gross monthly household income (i.e, before taxes National Insurance contributions or other deductions)
How many people in your household have an income?
Do you receive any state income. (e.g. benefits, pension, allowances)?
What is the property title situation of your household?
Does your family have a car or truck?
During the past five years, have any of my family members died before turning 5 years old?

enum.description: Our household income is consistently above 60% of the UK average. (i.e. Single: £9,500. Couple with no children: £14,200. Couple with two children £20,400).
Our household income this year is above 60% of the UK average. (i.e. Single: £9,500. Couple with no children: £14,200. Couple with two children £20,400).
Our household income is always below 60% of the UK average. (i.e. Single: £9,500. Couple with no children: £14,200. Couple with two children £20,400).

default.description: Our household income is consistently above 60% of the UK average. (i.e. Single: £9,500. Couple with no children: £14,200. Couple with two children £20,400).

enum.description: Our household income is stable.
Our household income goes up and down a bit.
Our household income goes up and down a lot making it difficult to plan ahead.

default.description: Our household income is stable.

enum.description: In our household, everyone has good credit scores, or has access to safe and affordable ways to borrow money (e.g. through a bank).
In our household, someone has bad credit scores, and we do not understand the financial information available to help us make good borrowing choices.
In our household, we have no access to credit, or lack information about accessing affordable credit, or we borrow from loan sharks.

default.description: In our household, everyone has good credit scores, or has access to safe and affordable ways to borrow money (e.g. through a bank).

enum.description: In our household, all family members have valid ID and proper documentation. We can prove our ID to anyone who asks. (These may include Driving License or Birth Certificate.)
Someone in our household has problems with documentation and we are actively looking to solve it.
Someone in our household does not have ID/documentation or has a problem with ID/documentation and does not know how to solve it or can’t afford to do so.

default.description: In our household, all family members have valid ID and proper documentation. We can prove our ID to anyone who asks. (These may include Driving License or Birth Certificate.)

description.es: My family has access to drinking water

enum.description: My family has access to drinking water through a faucet inside of their parcel.

My family has access to drinking water outside of their parcel, through a faucet, a well or a protected reservoir, a spring or protected water collection system. The distance to access drinking water is less than thirty minutes on foot, there and back, from the household.
My family consumes impotable water or has to bring drinking water from a place further than thirty minutes on foot, there and back.

default.description: My family has access to drinking water through a faucet inside of their parcel.

enum.description: Everyone in the house has a local GP, is registered and uses the service when needed, and is happy with it.
In our household, everyone is registered but not everyone uses the service, even when they should do.
Someone in the household is not registered at a local GP or does not seek medical treatment when needed.

default.description: Everyone in the house has a local GP, is registered and uses the service when needed, and is happy with it.

enum.description: No one in our household has dental problems and everyone visits a dentist regularly. Everyone understands the importance of dental hygiene.
Someone in our household has not been to the dentist in the past 5 years.
In our household, someone has dental problems and cannot or does not know how to access dental care or cannot afford it.

default.description: No one in our household has dental problems and everyone visits a dentist regularly. Everyone understands the importance of dental hygiene.

enum.description: We are confident that we know what we need for a healthy diet for all family members and make sure we consume a nutritious healthy diet.
We get confused with healthy eating information or cannot afford to buy healthy food.  I am not sure if we eat a healthy diet or not.
We don’t know very much about healthy eating or we are not concerned whether we are eating healthy food or not.  Our diet does not usually include fruit or vegetables.

default.description: We are confident that we know what we need for a healthy diet for all family members and make sure we consume a nutritious healthy diet.

description.es: We dispose of our rubbish well

enum.description: We use the full range of rubbish disposal services including pay-to-collect bulky items. When needed we take items to the neighbourhood recycling centre.
Our household has access to rubbish bins but don’t use them properly. I am not happy with rubbish disposal system and can’t afford to use pay-to-collect for bulky items.
Our household does not have access or does not use a household or communal waste bin. Rubbish is rarely collected in my area.

default.description: We use the full range of rubbish disposal services including pay-to-collect bulky items. When needed we take items to the neighbourhood recycling centre.

enum.description: Our house is very safe.  There are no faulty appliances, holes in walls, loose wires, or damp.  Doors and windows have locks and the building is appropriate for all weathers.
Our house has minor safety issues that are a risk for people who live there.  It is unsuitable in some weather conditions (e.g. windows let in the cold, there is risk of flooding).

Our house has serious safety issues that are a risk for people who live there.  It is unsuitable in certain weather conditions (e.g. significant damp or mould, always floods in heavy rains, doors and windows do not lock securely).

default.description: Our house is very safe.  There are no faulty appliances, holes in walls, loose wires, or damp.  Doors and windows have locks and the building is appropriate for all weathers.

enum.description: In our house, we always have access to a bathroom, which has proper ventilation, hot and cold running water, privacy, and is regularly cleaned.
In our house, we share the bathroom with more than 4 people and/or the bathroom is not regularly cleaned, or it is faulty.
In our house, we do not always have access to a bathroom and/or our bathroom is in a bad condition.

default.description: In our house, we always have access to a bathroom, which has proper ventilation, hot and cold running water, privacy, and is regularly cleaned.

enum.description: In our household, we can afford to pay for gas and/or electricity all the time.
In our household, we have gas and/or electricity but don't use it all the time because of the cost.
In our household in the past year, we sometimes have had no gas or electricity for heating or cooking.  Sometimes we need to choose between food and heating.

default.description: In our household, we can afford to pay for gas and/or electricity all the time.

description.es: We have the household appliances we need

enum.description: In our household, we have all essential appliances of our own and these work properly. These include: fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker etc.
In our household, some essential appliances are faulty or do not work properly.
In our household, we have very limited access to or do not have one or more essential household appliances.

default.description: In our household, we have all essential appliances of our own and these work properly. These include: fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker etc.

enum.description: In my house, adults, adolescents, and children do not sleep in the same bedrooms and the house is not overcrowded. Everyone has their privacy.
In our house, adults, adolescents, and children sleep in the same bedrooms and some people in our house would prefer more space or privacy to sleep.
In our house, multiple people sleep in the same bedroom.  A mix of adults, adolescents, and children share bedrooms with each other. Our house is overcrowded and we need more space.

default.description: In my house, adults, adolescents, and children do not sleep in the same bedrooms and the house is not overcrowded. Everyone has their privacy.

enum.description: In our household, we have a ventilated kitchen, a cooker and all the necessary kitchen equipment to cook, store food, and for all members of the house to eat properly.
In our household, we have an adequate kitchen; however we need to improve the facilities or need more equipment to cook and eat properly.
In our household, we do not have a proper kitchen or equipment. We have to cook elsewhere or share a space with many other people.

default.description: In our household, we have a ventilated kitchen, a cooker and all the necessary kitchen equipment to cook, store food, and for all members of the house to eat properly.

description.es: We have a phone and access to internet

enum.description: All adult members in our household have access to an affordable mobile phone and internet access at home.
In our household, we have access to mobile phones or the internet but the costs are a problem for us.
In our household, we have no access either to a phone or internet.

default.description: All adult members in our household have access to an affordable mobile phone and internet access at home.

enum.description: We feel safe in both the area we live in and where we work.
We feel unsafe in either the area we live in or where we work.
We feel unsafe in both the areas where we work and live.

default.description: We feel safe in both the area we live in and where we work.

description.es: We know how to read and write

enum.description: Everyone in our household can read and write at appropriate levels in English, including knowledge of writing for work purposes.
Everyone in our household can read and write well, but need help with more complex writing styles or more difficult reading.
Some members of our household do not read and write English at an appropriate level.

default.description: Everyone in our household can read and write at appropriate levels in English, including knowledge of writing for work purposes.

enum.description: All members in our household completed school and all children are on track to obtain their GCSEs. If 16-18 they are either at school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.
Some are at risk of not completing school or not getting a minimum of C in English and Maths GCSEs or not staying in school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.
There are members of our household that should be attending school but they are not. 16-18 year olds are not in school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.

default.description: All members in our household completed school and all children are on track to obtain their GCSEs. If 16-18 they are either at school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.

title.es: Knowledge and Skills to Generate Income

description.es: We know how to make an income

enum.description: Everyone in our household has the necessary skills to find employment or start their business.
People in our household have some skills needed to find employment but struggle with some aspects (e.g. application forms, interversion skills).
Some adults in our household have no skills to find employment, start their own business, or have never worked.

default.description: Everyone in our household has the necessary skills to find employment or start their business.

description.es: We are part of a group

enum.description: Everyone in our household is actively involved in groups where they can express themselves and feel supported.
Everyone in our household occasionally attends these groups but they do not meet up or attend often and are not well networked in the groups.
There is someone in our household who does not belong to any group (e.g. neighbourhood group, church, committees, parent groups, social groups).

default.description: Everyone in our household is actively involved in groups where they can express themselves and feel supported.

title.es: Registered to Vote and Votes in Elections

enum.description: Everyone in our household is registered to vote and does so regularly.
Everyone in our household is registered to vote but does not regularly vote.
Members in our household are not registered to vote or we are not motivated to vote in elections.

default.description: Everyone in our household is registered to vote and does so regularly.

enum.description: We are able to access information via a range of media to suit all of our news and entertainment needs.
We can access information but not always what we need/when we need it, or we have a limited range of media which we prefer to use for entertainment purposes rather than accessing the news.
We have no or very restricted access to media for our news and entertainment.

default.description: We are able to access information via a range of media to suit all of our news and entertainment needs.

description.es: We know how to petition authorities

enum.description: In our household when we see problems in our community, we know who to talk to (for example going to our local MP or councillors, or organising a petition).
In our household, we do not take action to solve problems in my community.  We only participate if someone else organises it.
In our household, we do not know how to contact local authorities or we think there's no point in getting involved because nothing ever changes.

default.description: In our household when we see problems in our community, we know who to talk to (for example going to our local MP or councillors, or organising a petition).

description.es: We have a family life plan

enum.description: In our household, we usually reflect about our present situation, and imagine how it could be different. We have concrete targets for the short, medium and long term and know how to reach them.
In our household, we can imagine where we want to be in the future but are not sure how to get there.
In our household, we can't imagine changing things or think we'd like things to be different, but what's the point?

default.description: In our household, we usually reflect about our present situation, and imagine how it could be different. We have concrete targets for the short, medium and long term and know how to reach them.

description.es: I trust in my abilities and achievements

enum.description: Most or all of the household have strong levels of self-confidence and self-esteem in a variety of situations.
Some but not all of the household have good self esteem or self confidence but in general don’t like being out of their comfort zone.
Most of our household find it difficult to be self-confident and lack self-esteem; we don't enter situations out of our comfort zone.

default.description: Most or all of the household have strong levels of self-confidence and self-esteem in a variety of situations.

description.es: I have control over my life decisions

enum.description: In our household, we are all involved in decision-making processes and have a voice in them. Everyone makes decisions independently in the areas that affect them directly.
Only some members of our household are decision makers and restrict input even when the matter affects someone directly.
In our household, one person makes the decisions and the rest have to live with it.

default.description: In our household, we are all involved in decision-making processes and have a voice in them. Everyone makes decisions independently in the areas that affect them directly.
